div.ab: zōt ud rāspīg: Anklesaria, Kotwal and Boyd, Geldner.

RecitationInstruction.ab: Y24.0a ahurāi mazdāi ...] ahurāi mazdāi OD LOYŠE daϑušō ahurahe mazdā̊ (Y24.12) 40.

Nerangs.ab: taštag kē-š hōm ud urwarām andar ān-iz ī-š ǰām andar dast stānišn abāg abastāg ul dārišn ahurāi mazdāi. ...
"He has to take in his hand the saucer that contains the hōm and the urwarām and the one that contains the ǰīwām and lift them up while reciting the abastāg ahurāi mazdāi. ..."

taštag kē-š hōm ud urwarām andar ān-iz ī-š ǰām andar dast stānišn abāg abastāg ul dārišn ēn kū čiyōn ud čand dārišn ā-m nē rōšnag dādweh guft hād gōš bālā dārišn frāz ō pēš dārišn u-š pad be nigerišn ahurāi mazdāi. ...

"He has to take in his hand the saucer that contains the hōm and the urwarām and the one that contains the ǰīwām and hold them up while reciting the Avestan text. It is not clear to me how, and how long, it should be held up. Dādweh said that he has to hold it to the height of his ears, he has to hold it in front of (his face) and gaze at it (while reciting) ahurāi mazdāi. ..."

Quotations.ab: Cf. N28.46b Kotwal and Kreyenbroek, 2003, pp. 104-105:

u-š pad ahurāi mazdāi hōm ud urwarām †be †war ī ǰīuu ul dārišn ēn kū čiyōn ud čand dārišn ā-m nē rōšnag dādweh guft hād gōš bālāy dārišn frāz ō pēš dārišn u-š pad be nigerišn Ka-š ahurāi mazdāibe guft hāwan be šōyišn.

"And at ahurāi mazdāi he should lift up the hōm and urwarām together face on face with jīw. It is not clear to me how, and how long, it should be held up. Dādweh said: "He should hold it up to the height of his ears, he has to hold it in front of (his face), and gaze at it. When he has finished reciting ahurāi mazdāi he should wash the mortar."

ēd rāy pad ahurāi mazdāi hassārīh ī daθuš zōhr ham dil ī ōy zōt rāst dārišn ud *ātrawaxšān ham bāzag ī ōy zōt rāst dārišn kū tā ardēštārān andar kōxšišin ī abāg anērān nēwdiltarud wāstryōšān pad warz ud ābādīh ī gēhān bāzāyōztar

"On account of this, at ahurāi mazdāi, the zōhr should be held on top of the daθuš exactly level with the heart of the Zōt, and the *Ātrawaxšān should hold (their) hands exactly level with the arm of the Zōt. so that the warriors may become mor brave in fighting with non-Iranians, and the husbandmen more strongarmed in the culituvation of the land and care of the creatures."

ModernPractice.ab: "The chief priest, removing the mortar outside the water container, places (it) upside-down in front of him on the table and recites with the assistant priest:"
"As both priests recite the first line of st. I, the zōt takes the mortar out of the large basin of water and sets it upside down on the ritual table directly in front of him"
